metadata.title: CVE-2017-16082 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A remote code execution vulnerability was found within the pg module whenthe remote database or query specifies a specially crafted column name.There are 2 likely scenarios in which one would likely be vulnerable. 1)Executing unsafe, user-supplied sql which contains a malicious column name.2) Connecting to an untrusted database and executing a query which returnsresults where any of the column names are malicious.

criterions.comment: node-postgres: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
